# add a license to prod pool
exec relay add --pool prod --file license.lic --key 9E32DD-D8CC22-771926-C2D834-C506DC-V3 --public-key e8601e48b69383ba520245fd07971e983d06d22c4257cfd82304601479cee788

# add another license to dev pool
exec relay add --pool dev --file license_2.lic --key 9A96B8-FD08CD-8C433B-7657C8-8A8655-V3 --public-key e8601e48b69383ba520245fd07971e983d06d22c4257cfd82304601479cee788

# confirm both licenses are added
exec relay ls --plain
stdout 'dcea31a4-1664-4633-9f52-4a1b0b5ea2ef'
stdout 'e9b6f649-d8c2-49e3-9d41-aab32f0d08a3'

# delete license from prod pool using GUID
exec relay del --license dcea31a4-1664-4633-9f52-4a1b0b5ea2ef

# expect output indicating success
stdout 'license deleted successfully'

# verify the license is deleted from prod pool
exec relay ls --pool prod --plain
stdout 'license pool is empty'

# verify the dev pool license still exists
exec relay ls --pool dev --plain
stdout 'e9b6f649-d8c2-49e3-9d41-aab32f0d08a3'

# delete license from dev pool using GUID
exec relay del --license e9b6f649-d8c2-49e3-9d41-aab32f0d08a3

# expect output indicating success
stdout 'license deleted successfully'

# verify both pools are now empty
exec relay ls --plain
stdout 'license pool is empty'
